newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila sees rising fiscal surpluses until 2002.
newsitem.headline: Manila sees rising fiscal surpluses until 2002.

text.p: The Philippines is expected to post ballooning fiscal surpluses until year 2002, documents released by the Department of Finance on Monday said.
The documents said the fiscal surplus would reach a record 37.11 billion pesos by year 2002, or 0.8 percent of the gross national product.
The government registered a surplus of 6.256 billion pesos last year.
This year, it is targetting a 12.135 billion peso surplus. It posted a deficit of 3.392 billion pesos in January, 1997.
The fiscal surplus would balloon to 15.999 billion pesos by next year, 23.200 billion pesos by 1999, and 30.0 billion pesos by year 2000, the finance department said.
A finance official said the targetted surpluses will be attained as the government implements the comprehensive tax reform package and streamlines the bureaucracy.
The government is working on the last phase of the tax reform package which involves the restructuring of the corporate and personal income taxes.
